file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 49-26-02-04 - APU STARTER/GENERATOR ACCESSORIES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL APU STARTER/GENERATOR ACCESSORIES - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH APU T-62T-40C14 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the starter-generator accessories. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED APU STARTER-GENERATOR ACCESSO- WITH APU 49-26-02-000-801-A RIES - REMOVAL T-62T-40C14 AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED APU STARTER-GENERATOR ACCESSO- WITH APU 49-26-02-400-801-A RIES - INSTALLATION T-62T-40C14 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 49-26-02 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 49-26-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH APU T-62T-40C14 2. APU STARTER-GENERATOR ACCESSORIES - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey these instructions to remove the starter-generator accessories. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 49-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 49-15-00-000-801-A/400 APU COWLING - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 313 APU D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the work area 1 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task APU I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 49-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO THE PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the APU FUEL SOV circuit breaker and attach DO- NOT-CLOSE tags to it. (2) On the left power control and distribution box, open the APU GEN START circuit breaker and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 49-26-02 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Put the workstand under the aircraft tail cone. (4) Remove the APU cowling ( AMM TASK 49-15-00-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL AIRCRAFT THAT DO NOT HAVE THE NEW SERIES 145[minus ]54858 APU COWLINGS INSTALLED (1) Release the clamp (3) and remove the inlet flexible duct (2) from the starter-generator (1). (2) Remove the bolts (6) and washers (7) and then remove the air outlet duct (5) from the starter-generator mounting pad (8). Refer to DET. B of Figure 401. (3) Put a cover on the starter-generator air inlet and outlet to prevent damage to the starter-generator. K. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-B EFFECTIVITY: APU COWLING SERIES 145[minus ]54858 (1) Release the clamp (2) and remove the inlet flexible duct (3) from the starter-generator (1). (2) Release the clamp (4) and remove the drain hose (5) from the inlet drain duct (6) (3) Release the clamp (7) from the APU mounting. (4) Remove the bolt (11), washers (9) and nut (8) and then release the clamp (10) from the bracket (12). (5) Remove the bolts (13), washers (14) and nuts (15) and then remove the adapter duct (16) from the bracket (17). (6) Remove the bolts (18), washers (19), and the air outlet duct (20) from the starter- generator mounting pad (21). (7) Put a cover on the starter-generator air inlet and outlet to prevent damage to the starter-generator. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 49-26-02 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL AIRCRAFT THAT DO NOT HAVE THE NEW SERIES 145[minus ]54858 APU COWLINGS INSTALLED Starter/Generator Accessories - Removal/Installation Figure 401 6. BOLT (4) A 7. WASHER (4) B ZONE 313 5. AIR OUTLET DUCT 4. AIR OUTLET FLEXIBLE DUCT 3. CLAMP DET. A 1. STARTER-GENERATOR 2. AIR INLET FLEXIBLE DUCT 7. WASHER (4 PLACES) 8. APU STARTER-GENERATOR MOUNTING PAD 6. BOLT (4 PLACES) APU STARTER-GENERATOR (REF.) 5. AIR OUTLET DUCT AIR INLET DET. B DRAIN HOSE 145AMM490314.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 49-26-02 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: APU COWLING 145[minus ]54858 SERIES Starter/Generator Accessories - Removal/Installation Figure 402 1 18. BOLT A 19. WASHER ZONE 313 20. AIR OUTLET DUCT 21. MOUNTING PAD 1. START GENERATOR 2. CLAMP 3. INLET FLEXIBLE DUCT 4. CLAMP 5. DRAIN HOSE B DET. A 7. CLAMP 6. INLET DRAIN DUCT UPPER OIL COOLER BRACKET ASSEMBLY AIR / OIL COOLER 13. BOLTS 14. WASHER LOWER OIL COOLER BRACKET 8. NUT 17. BRACKET GEARBOX ASSEMBLY 12. BRACKET 11. BOLT 9. WASHER 9. WASHER 14. WASHER 14. WASHER 15. NUT 10. CLAMP 16. ADAPTER DUCT DET. B 1 TORQUE: 2.3 TO 2.8 N.m (20 TO 25 lb.in) 145AMM490313.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 49-26-02 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 49-26-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH APU T-62T-40C14 3. APU STARTER-GENERATOR ACCESSORIES - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey these instructions to install the starter-generator accessories. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 49-15-00-400-801-A/400 APU COWLING - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 313 APU D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque Wrench To torque the nuts available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Ladder To get access to the work area 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS20995 Lockwire AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task APU EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 49-26-02 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL AIRCRAFT THAT DO NOT HAVE THE NEW SERIES145[minus ]54858 APU COWLINGS INSTALLED (1) NOTE: All the adjustable clamps that you removed must be lockwired in this installation procedure. Remove the cover that you put on the starter-generator air inlet and outlet. (2) Install the air outlet duct (5) on the starter-generator mounting pad (8) with the bolts (6) and washers (7). Refer to DET. B of (Figure 401). (3) Install the inlet flexible duct (2) on the starter generator (1) and tighten the adjustable clamp (3). J. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-B EFFECTIVITY: APU COWLING SERIES 145[minus ]54858 (1) NOTE: All the adjustable clamps that you removed must be lockwired in this installation procedure. Remove the cover that you put on the starter-generator air inlet and outlet. (2) Install the inlet flexible duct (3) on the starter-generator (1) and tighten the adjustable clamp (2). (3) Install the drain hose (5) on the inlet drain duct (6) and tighten the adjustable clamp (4). (4) Install the clamp (7) at the APU mounting. (5) Install the clamp (10) on the bracket (12) with the bolt (11), washers (9), and nut (8). (6) Install the adapter duct (16) on the bracket (17) with the bolts (13), washers (14), and nuts (15). (7) Install the air outlet duct (20) on the starter-generator mounting pad (21) with the bolts (18) and washers (19). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the APU cowling ( AMM TASK 49-15-00-400-801-A/400). (2) Remove the workstand from the work area. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag and close the APU FUEL SOV circuit breaker. (4) On the left power control and distribution box, remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag and close the APU GEN START circuit breaker. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 49-26-02 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
